Dragon Age Spells
Blood Magic
You use the blood within you as a conduit for whispered communication. You point to a willing creature within range and establish a mental connection with them. The target can hear your whispered message as though you were speaking directly into their mind. They can reply in a whisper that only you can hear, as long as they are within range.
This spell works only on creatures with blood and does not function on constructs, elementals, or the undead.

Blood Magic
You magically encode a message into a medium (such as paper, cloth, or carved surfaces) using drops of your blood as ink. The message is indecipherable to anyone without your permission. A creature you touch while casting this spell gains the ability to read the encoded message for the duration.
The message can only be decrypted by you or those you've touched during the casting of this spell. Attempting to decode the message without permission requires a successful Intelligence (Arcana) check against your spell save DC.

Blood Magic
You manipulate the blood of a creature that has moved at least 15 feet in a straight line toward you, causing its circulation to seize. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or become immobile, their movement reduced to 0 for the remainder of the turn. On a successful save, their movement is unaffected and can continue their turn
At 5th level, you can target two creatures with this spell.
At 11th level, you can target three creatures with this spell.
At 17th level, you can target four creatures with this spell.

Blood Magic
You summon the destructive power of blood magic to burn a creature from the inside out. Choose one creature within range that has blood. The target takes 1d12 necrotic damage as the blood inside their body ignites.
At 5th level, the damage increases to 2d12.
At 11th level, the damage increases to 3d12.
At 17th level, the damage increases to 4d12.

Blood Magic
When a creature within 10 feet of you dies or hits 0 hit points, you tap into your blood magic to retaliate. As the attacker takes their final breath you use the last drops of blood to sustain yourself longer and you heal yourself for 1d4 hit points.
At 5th level, healing increase to 2d4.
At 11th level, healing increase to 3d4.
At 17th level, healing increase to 4d4.

Blood Magic
You weave tendrils of blood magic to inflict immense, excruciating pain on a creature within range. This pain leaves no physical marks but causes intense psychological and sensory torment. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or be wracked with pain for the duration, incapacitated and unable to take actions or reactions.
While the target is under the effects of this spell, you and your allies have advantage on Intimidation and Insight checks made against them.
The spell is primarily used in interrogation or coercion and is not typically suited for combat. A target affected by this spell is not harmed physically but may suffer mental or emotional trauma at the DM's discretion.
At higher levels: No additional benefits are gained.

You cause a creature's blood to boil, forcing it to burst in a violent explosion. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 necrotic damage as their blood is forcibly manipulated. On a successful save, they take half as much damage.
At higher levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

You draw upon your life force to create a crimson ward that shields a creature you touch. The target's AC becomes 13 + your spellcasting ability modifier if it is not wearing armor. If ant attacks against the target miss while under the effect of this spell, it loses 1d4 hit points at the start of its next turn, as the ward siphons their vitality to sustain its protective magic for longer.

Blood Magic
You draw upon the life force of a willing creature to replenish your own health. The target creature rolls 1d10 and takes necrotic damage equal to the result. You then regain hit points equal to the damage taken + your spellcasting ability modifier. Creatures without blood (such as elementals and constructs) cannot be targeted by this spell.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage can increase by 1d10 for each slot above 2nd.

Blood Magic
You draw upon the residual life force of the dying to replenish your own. If a living creature dies within 10 feet of you while this spell is active, as a reaction, you can roll a die equal to your hit dice to heal a number of hit points equal to the result plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the number of dice you roll increases by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

Blood Magic
You infuse the blood of a creature within range with a corrosive poison. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 3d6 acid damage, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to deal 3d6 acid damage to the target automatically. The spell ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.
If the spell reduces the target’s hit points to 0, it explodes in a spray of blood, flesh, and bones. Creatures within 10 feet of the explosion must make a Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 necrotic damage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd. At 5th level or higher, those affected by the blast radius must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be subject to the effects of Walking Bomb at the 3rd level (the acid damage) for 1 minute.

Blood Magic
You take control of a creature's blood, forcing its body to move against its will. Choose one creature that has blood within range. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you can control its movements for the duration. The creature can only move up to its movement speed and cannot take reactions. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
While controlling the creature, you can use your bonus action to direct it to move up to half its speed each turn. If you choose to move it into a harmful situation (such as moving it into a dangerous terrain), it can make another Constitution saving throw to resist. This effect ends if the creature reaches 0 hit points or if it is moved out of range.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

Blood Magic
You cause the blood within a creature's body to rupture violently. Choose one creature within range that has blood. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 4d6 necrotic damage, and their blood vessels are damaged, causing them to become frightened for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half the damage and is not frightened.
While frightened in this way, the creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures that are not you.
Additionally, any creature within 30 feet of the target that can see the target must also make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this effect for 24 hours. Creatures that fail the saving throw become frightened for 1 minute, but can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.
The frightened condition from this spell ends early if the target succeeds on a saving throw at the end of its turn.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

Blood Magic
You begin to make the blood of those around you boil, causing excruciating pain in an aura within a 15-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. When a creature enters the aura for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage and be incapacitated until the end of its next turn. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage and is immune to being incapacitated this way for 24 hours.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot above 4th.

Blood Magic
You call upon the life force of an ally within 30 feet of you, draining it to fuel a devastating explosion of necrotic power. The chosen ally must have blood, but they do not need to be willing. The ally takes 50 hit points of necrotic damage, regardless of their current hit points, and may fall unconscious if the damage reduces them to 0 hit points. The pain and suffering from the blood sacrifice empower your magic, causing an eruption of dark energy.
All creatures within a 30-foot radius of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, creatures take 8d8 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful save. The ally whose life force was sacrificed suffers the full damage, regardless of their saving throw.
If the ally is reduced to 0 hit points by the spell, the damage increases to 12d8 necrotic damage, and the blast radius expands by 10 feet. The ally may remain unconscious, but their body is irrevocably drained of life energy.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the area of effect increases by 10 feet for each slot above 5th.

Blood Magic
You perform a dark ritual, using a dagger as the focus of the spell. As you plunge the blade into your own flesh or the flesh of a nearby creature, blood spills from the wound, and you draw on the life force of those around you to power the ritual. The blood of the fallen and the wounded in the area is called forth, transforming into blood-red daggers that you control with a twisted will.
A 40-foot radius around you becomes an area of death, where the blood of any creature that has taken damage in the past minute swirls and rises into the air. These blood-daggers are then shaped into sharp, deadly weapons, each one powered by the life force of the fallen. You send these daggers flying at a single target within range.
The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 piercing damage and 1d6 necrotic damage for every creature within range that has less than its maximum hit points. The daggers shred through the target's body, each blade digging deep and causing the blood to pour from their wounds. The target is pinned to the ground by the daggers unless they succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC to break free.
On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not pinned.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the range of the spell increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.
necromancy, blood magic, area of effect 5 Necromancy 1 action Instantaneous Self (40-foot radius, increases at higher levels) true true true false false
Blood Magic
You unleash a wave of dark, blood-soaked magic that siphons the life force of all creatures within a 20-foot radius. Each creature of your choice within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d8 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the total damage dealt. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage, and you regain no hit points from that creature.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radius increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.

Blood Magic
You seize control of a creature's body by using their blood against them. Choose one creature within range that you can see. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, their blood boils and bends to your will, rendering them a puppet under your control.
For the duration, you can use your bonus action to command the controlled creature to take one of the following actions:
Attack: The creature makes one weapon or natural attack (including up to level 2 spells) against a target of your choice within its reach.
Move: The creature moves up to its full speed in a direction you choose.
The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. While under your control, the creature cannot take reactions, actions or bonus actions.
On a successful save, the creature takes 4d8 necrotic damage but is no longer controlled.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 6th.

Wizard, Sorcerer, Bard, Druid, Warlock
A freezing blast of icy energy lances out from your hand, striking one creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 3d6 cold damage and is restrained until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not restrained.
If the target is restrained, it can use its action to attempt to break free. The target can make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check against your spell save DC to break free at the end of each of its turns.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the cold damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

Wizard, Sorcerer, Bard, Druid, Warlock
You momentarily step into the Fade, surrounding yourself with its veil to briefly become incorporeal. You blink through the fabric of reality, moving up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. While enveloped in the Fade, you cannot be affected by physical attacks or conditions.
If you pass through creatures while using this ability, it costs you 10 feet of movement to travel through them. They must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 cold damage as the veil briefly brushes against them. Ending your turn in an enemy's space will cause you to shift to the nearest unoccupied space.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the distance you can teleport increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

You conjure a layer of stony armor that envelops your body, granting you enhanced protection. For the duration, you gain temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1). These temporary hit points last until they are depleted or the spell ends.
While the armor lasts, you also gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.
If the temporary hit points are reduced to 0, the armor shatters, ending the spell.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st. 3rd or 4th level it lasts 8 hours and above 24 hours

Wizard, Sorcerer, Bard, Druid, Warlock
You place a deadly curse on a creature, causing it to suffer lingering life-draining effects. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d6 necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns for the duration of the curse. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage at the start of each of its turns.
The target can make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the curse early.
If the target is reduced to 0 hit points while under the effect of this spell, it automatically dies, as the curse drains the last remnants of life from its body.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

Wizard, Sorcerer, Bard, Druid, Warlock
You unleash a rapid barrage of elemental energy, harnessing the power of your last elemental attack. The damage type of this spell matches the damage type of the previous spell you cast, whether that be fire, cold, lightning, acid, or even physical damage types like bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing.
If your previous spell or melee attack involved a damage type (whether an elemental spell or a physical weapon attack), the Elemental Barrage mimics that type and projects it in the form of multiple projectiles or waves, dealing 4d6 damage of the chosen type. If you have not cast an elemental spell or made a melee attack on your turn, this spell fails to manifest.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the number of targets increases by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

You create a protective barrier of magical energy around yourself and up to two willing creatures within range. The barrier grants each target temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. When the temporary hit points are depleted, the barrier dissipates, and no excess damage affects the creature.
The barrier lasts until the start of your next turn.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of targets increases by 1 for each slot level above 2nd and you can choose one of the following benefits:
Extend the Barrier: The barrier lasts for one additional round or Increase the Barrier: The temporary hit points granted increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

You conjure 3 fiery mines that hover in the air within range, each occupying a 5-foot square you can see. You must place these mines in unoccupied spaces adjacent to one another, forming a line, triangle, or square. The mines remain dormant until the start of your next turn. Once active, they detonate when a creature enters their space or ends its turn there. When a mine detonates, it explodes in a 5-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d10 fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Untriggered mines remain for 1 hour or until they detonate.

You conjure 2 ice mines that hover in the air within range, each occupying a 5-foot square you can see. You can place these mines anywhere within range of the spell. The mines remain dormant until the start of your next turn. Once active, they detonate when a creature enters their space or ends its turn there.
